intro: Lepidanthus, commonly known as the silverleaf plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive silver-green foliage, which gives it its common name. The leaves are usually ovate or elliptical and have a velvety texture. Lepidanthus species are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soil.
